items.text: I feel good about myself only when others admire me.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is dependent on external validation.

items.text: I need constant praise to feel worthwhile.
items.rationale: Self-worth is tied to receiving praise.

items.text: If people don't notice me, I feel like I'm nothing.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is contingent on being noticed.

items.text: I often change my opinion to gain approval.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is dependent on others' approval.

items.text: I feel empty if I'm not the center of attention.
items.rationale: Self-esteem relies on being the focus.

items.text: I need others to acknowledge my achievements to feel successful.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is contingent on external acknowledgment.

items.text: I feel anxious if I'm not praised for my efforts.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is dependent on receiving praise.

items.text: I often seek reassurance from others about my worth.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is contingent on external reassurance.

items.text: I feel validated only when others recognize my talents.
I feel insecure if I'm not complimented regularly.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is contingent on receiving compliments.

items.text: I often need others to tell me I'm doing well to feel confident.
items.rationale: Self-esteem is dependent on external validation.

items.text: I feel like a failure if others don't acknowledge my success.
I sometimes feel good about myself without needing others' approval.
items.rationale: Indicates some independence from external validation.

items.text: I occasionally feel confident even when I'm not praised.
items.rationale: Suggests partial reliance on external praise.

items.text: I feel worthy when I achieve my goals, regardless of others' opinions.
items.rationale: Could map to Self-Sacrificing Self-Enhancement (self-driven achievement).

items.text: I often think others are beneath me.
I quickly lose respect for people who don't meet my standards.
I often criticize others to feel better about myself.
items.rationale: Devaluation as a means of self-enhancement.

items.text: I tend to look down on people who don't agree with me.
items.rationale: Devaluation of those with differing opinions.

items.text: I often dismiss others' opinions as unimportant.
I feel superior to most people I meet.
I often belittle others to assert my dominance.
items.rationale: Devaluation as a form of dominance.

items.text: I find it easy to point out others' flaws.
I often feel others are not worth my time.
I tend to see others as inferior to me.
I often think people are not as competent as I am.
I sometimes feel others have nothing to offer me.
I occasionally find myself dismissing others' contributions.
items.rationale: Indicates some tendency to devalue others.

items.text: I feel others are beneath me, but I still need their approval.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (need for approval).

items.text: I get furious when people don't give me the respect I deserve.
items.rationale: Anger due to perceived lack of respect.

items.text: I feel intense anger when others don't recognize my importance.
I can't stand it when people don't treat me as special.
items.rationale: Rage due to unmet expectations of special treatment.

items.text: I become enraged when others don't acknowledge my superiority.
items.rationale: Rage from lack of acknowledgment of superiority.

items.text: I feel a burning anger when I'm not given priority.
items.rationale: Rage due to unmet expectations of priority.

items.text: I get extremely upset when others don't cater to my needs.
items.rationale: Rage from unmet needs and expectations.

items.text: I feel intense frustration when I'm not the center of attention.
items.rationale: Rage due to lack of attention.

items.text: I become furious when others don't follow my lead.
items.rationale: Rage from unmet expectations of leadership.

items.text: I feel a deep anger when others don't appreciate my efforts.
items.rationale: Rage due to lack of appreciation.

items.text: I get angry when people don't give me the attention I deserve.
items.rationale: Rage from unmet expectations of attention.

items.text: I feel a strong sense of injustice when I'm not treated as special.
I sometimes feel angry when others don't meet my expectations.
I occasionally get upset when I'm not given special treatment.
I feel angry when others don't respect me, but I also feel worthless.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (feelings of worthlessness).

items.text: I often manipulate others to get what I want.
I use others to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Exploitation of others for personal goals.

items.text: I often take advantage of others' weaknesses.
I have no problem using people to get ahead.
I often charm people to get what I want.
I see others as tools to achieve my objectives.
items.rationale: Viewing others as means to an end.

items.text: I often manipulate situations to my advantage.
I use flattery to get what I want from others.
I often exploit others' kindness for my benefit.
I have no qualms about using others to get what I need.
items.rationale: Lack of remorse in exploiting others.

items.text: I often use others' resources for my own gain.
I sometimes use others to achieve my goals, but I feel guilty.
I occasionally manipulate others, but I try to avoid it.
I use others to get what I want, but I also need their approval.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (need for approval).

items.text: I often imagine myself as a powerful and influential person.
I frequently daydream about being admired by many.
I often picture myself achieving great things.
I imagine myself as someone who is highly respected.
I often fantasize about being the best in my field.
I frequently envision myself as a celebrity.
I often dream about being the center of attention.
I imagine myself as someone who changes the world.
I often see myself as a hero in my daydreams.
I frequently imagine myself as a leader of many.
I often picture myself as someone who is envied by others.
I sometimes fantasize about being admired, but I doubt it will happen.
items.rationale: Indicates some grandiose fantasies with doubt.

items.text: I occasionally daydream about being powerful, but I know it's unrealistic.
items.rationale: Suggests some grandiose fantasies with realism.

items.text: I fantasize about being admired, but I also feel unworthy.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (feelings of unworthiness).

items.text: I often hide my true feelings from others.
I rarely let others see the real me.
I often pretend to be someone I'm not.
I keep my vulnerabilities hidden from others.
I often put on a facade to protect myself.
items.rationale: Use of a facade for self-protection.

items.text: I rarely share my true thoughts with others.
I often act differently around different people.
I keep my true intentions hidden from others.
I often feel like I'm wearing a mask around others.
I rarely let others see my weaknesses.
I often hide my true self to avoid judgment.
I sometimes hide my true feelings, but I wish I didn't have to.
items.rationale: Indicates some concealment with desire for openness.

items.text: I occasionally pretend to be someone I'm not, but I feel guilty.
I hide my true self, but I also need others to see my worth.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (need for validation).

items.text: I often help others to feel better about myself.
items.rationale: Helping others as a means of self-enhancement.

items.text: I feel good about myself when I put others' needs first.
I often go out of my way to help others to boost my self-esteem.
I feel more valuable when I make sacrifices for others.
I often prioritize others' needs to feel better about myself.
I feel a sense of pride when I help others.
I often feel better about myself when I make others happy.
I feel more confident when I am selfless.
I often feel more important when I help others.
I feel a sense of fulfillment when I put others first.
I often feel like a better person when I make sacrifices for others.
I sometimes help others to feel better about myself, but I also feel used.
items.rationale: Indicates self-enhancement with feelings of being used.

items.text: I occasionally put others first to boost my self-esteem, but I feel conflicted.
I help others to feel better about myself, but I also need their approval.
items.rationale: Could map to Contingent Self-Esteem (need for approval).
